I'd just like to say that several of you people are assholes.

Thankyou, and goodnight.Szevvy Forever!

title: Re: Goodbye.
content:
Well, if her reason for leaving was because everyone around here is fucking lazy, complacent, and generally not caring about Keen anymore then hell yes she's got a point.

The leading Admins don't even give a shit about this community anymore... I tried to get people interested in revamping the forum, and all the staff basically said was, "Yeah, we don't really give a shit, so we'll compromise and create a new subforum. We'll delete it if it's not active enough." (Like they're ever here enough to notice)


I'm sure LL will be on MSN a few times though, but not for a few weeks. Basically PCKF is a forum that can't get anything done, much like an American beuracracy. It's still stuck with the same background it had in 2000, it's gotten about maybe 3 new popular members, and lost about 10 since 2001.

I come on here like once every six months, and its still no different. We get maybe 10 posts a day --50 is we're really pushing it. I know of dying communities that get more posts than that!

Then when active members who like to do shit, like LL, leave, everyone goes, "WHY R U LEAVIN???//"

I'll tell you why, because it's a dead end community that never changes. The same assholes that have been posting here now are the same assholes who were posting here in 2001. This forum is a monument of how not to keep a community together --never change, never get new members, never bother to make fangames/mods, and never create insentives to post.

[/tirade]~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Goodbye.

I've just became an admin a few days ago and I do care about this board (just like before). But I really don't want to get any more sub-forums here either. This is a Keen board, not some chit chat (or whatever's the word) board for everything. If people come here because of non-Keen related subjects, I don't frankly care if they don't come here at all. If new members join they should be into Keen, I think we've seen already enough new members with no interest in Keen whatsoever. I don't think this is dying, either. If you think a forum is dying if it hasn't 30000 members that produce 100 times more stuff than this forum, I guess then we are dead. Anyways, with different forums for more non-Keen related subjects there won't be any achievement in the Keen-related progress such as mods and fan art. I don't believe such will atract more people to Keen subjects.. Better a small community that's into Keen than large that specializes on bullshit.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"

content:

title: Re: Goodbye.
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]LordOfGlobox I'll tell you why, because it's a dead end community that never changes. The same assholes that have been posting here now are the same assholes who were posting here in 2001. This forum is a monument of how not to keep a community together --never change, never get new members, never bother to make fangames/mods, and never create insentives to post.[hr][/quote]
How should we change? There is not much to discuss about Keen that has not already been talked through many times, and apart from patching and the occasional mod, there is not much we can do to change the Keen engine.

When you say that people "never bother to make fangames/mods", you make it sound like a simple task that people simply don't do because they are lazy - something like filing a tax return or mowing the lawn. (I'm sure you know this isn't the case, but that's not what you imply.) I would love to make a mod, but I have little skill at designing levels and no great deal of artistic talent, and I would hate to release something I didn't feel was of a good standard.

How can we attract new members, and how should we create new incentives to post? The main incentive for people to join in is that they are Keen fans, and converting them is almost entirely dependent on new games or some input from the creators - neither of which we have or are likely to any time in the future (except the release of the Keen source code, which is only a small draw). The main incentive to post on most big forums is a large and diverse user base, and we can't have that without a reasonably sized core of Keen fans who can produce enough interesting content to keep them coming; since those fans either keep leaving or lower the frequency of their posting (or did, whilst there were still enough for the effect to be noticeable), the community is stuck in a vicious circle which will eventually lead to its demise.

I honestly don't think there is a great deal that can be done to save the community: it was beginning to pass its prime when I joined three years back, and the main source of new members dried up a long time ago. It doesn't help that we've taken various hits recently, including the ezBoard hacking and the short-lived return of Shocksund. Unless someone creates an amazing game or movie that is amazing enough to attract (or even attract the attention of - there are still a fair few Keen fans floating around the net) countless people to sign up, we're doomed. Still, we might as well enjoy it while it lasts.[url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

title: Re: Goodbye.
content:
Djaser wrote:

-"I tell you it's worse, nobody even cares when someone got something done. So why bother doing anything at all?"-

Thats one of the reasons I quit modding keen after my first mod, after all that work only a handful of people bothered to reply.

Ofcourse you could say that one should make mods for themselves, but thats not true you make mods for other people to play. but there doesn't seem to be much interest here.

title: Re: Goodbye.
content:
Don't forget that the Keen community is pretty small, and there are a lot of lurkers out there, so you can't really expect a huge reaction when you release a mod. If you want a bigger reaction you'd need to mod a game with a larger community behind it.

The problem I always have is, well, what do you say? One post saying that it's nice to see another mod pretty much sums it up, there's only so much you can comment about. It doesn't mean I don't like mods, I just have nothing much to say - what's good, what's not, etc. doesn't take that long to say. More often than not there are things that could be improved, but if you comment about those aspects too much you get accused of being negative, even if you really don't mean it that way.

So it is true, you need to mod for yourself, and if other people play it that's just a bonus.

title: A message to the whip-snappers
content:
The PCKF's activity has decreased a lot since I joined back in 2000-or-2001, but what do you expect? Commander Keen was something that happened one and a half decades ago, and hasn't happened again since (unless you count GameBoy Keen, but you probably don't, heh heh).
It's a computer game. It's not your Life's Purpose. Of course people are going to move on as they get older, and the rate of newbies is going to decrease as better games than Commander Keen get developed.

BETTER GAMES THAN COMMANDER KEEN?!?! NO!!!!!! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img]

Yes.

Anywho, take a look at other similar forums. "This Strife", whose forums were full of people who enjoyed games like Keen and Duke Nukem, was huge in 2001. Now it is a wasteland. The only regularly active members are the moderators, who basically use it as a messageboard for each other.
The DoomWorld forums may have a lot of members, but it's still a pretty slow place. PCKF >> Doomworld.

The fact that some people still care about keeping the PCKF as hyperactive as it was a few years ago means it's really not in such bad shape. It's just that all the stuff that we did back then was done in the name of fun, not in the name of the PCKF.

Don't blame the admins. Don't blame lazy artists. Don't even blame whoever's fault it is - just help solve the problem: Do some KEEN STUFF!!! Nobody else is gonna do it because you tell them to!

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rollhead.gif[/img]

Show some interest you guys. I've replied on every single fangame thread atleast once for all modern fangames. It wouldn't kill us all to put a little effort and type a message to the people who are atleast going to give you a half hour of fun from their fangame --and even if they don't, atleast you'll get some people who will.

As idiotic as this is to say, we need to show a little forum spirit. It doesn't take much, just post a little bit.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

title: Re: A message to the whip-snappers
content:
"Oh look, another fucling fangame. I guess I won't post... they probably won't complete it anyways..."
If no one is interested in your fangame, it makes it really hard to do something that's already REALLY hard.

Well that problem comes about because so many people spend five minutes thinking up of a "good keen idea", then write a huge post about how they're going to write a fangame, how cool it'll be, how many other people in the community want to help, and just when they've hyped it up they decide it's boring and move on to something else, or they realise how hard it actually is to write a game and give up.

After you see that happen to 90% of people's fangame announcements, it's a little difficult to get excited about yet another probable let down...

I think what people don't realise is that you don't write a fangame for the community, you write it for yourself. If the community is interested in it that's a bonus, but if not you need enough interest in it yourself that you'll keep going even if nobody seems to care about it.

That's the prime reason why I don't often mention much about the game editor I'm working on - I actually spend a large amount of my spare time on it (it's not uncommon for me to be programming for 15 hours a day on weekends), but I feel that if I start hyping it up now, people will only get disappointed, or they'll think I've given up when I don't make much progress for a few months - and hey, I enjoy it even if I'm the only one who knows anything much about it. I'd much rather post a message one day that instead of saying "I've just thought of a cool idea for a program" says "Hey I've written a program, it does this and this, and you can download it here and start using it right now." I know that doing that will generate *much* more response because people won't have to worry about being let down again.

So yes, that's my somewhat lengthy reasoning behind avoiding premature announcements [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

title: Re: A message to the whip-snappers
content:
I agree...

I'm just hoping when you bring people together for fun, it'll help people loosen up and get the kind of support they need.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

title: Re: A message to the whip-snappers
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Maybe we should all find some friends who might like Commander Keen? Unfortunately, I've tried to tell my friends about it, but they seem to think it's too immature or something. I should tell some younger people. [hr][/quote]

Well, when I was 15 years old, I had a 16 years old friend that was a Keen-fanatic. He spent hours and hours... er, entire days, playing Commander Keen. Unfortunately: 1) He was too silly. 2) He didn't speak english because we (my friend and I) live in a country that only speaks spanish. 3) I haven't seen him anymore.

Just think, I knew also some little guys (6-10 years old) that liked Commander Keen just because that was the game that was installed in the old computer of the school's secretary. I'm talking of 2004. Even with modern games filled with blood and guts that amuse millions of people over the world, there are still children that like old DOS EGA-color platform games.

(Sorry, I don't remember what was the point of this writing.)
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] [hr]
"Eat your veggies!"

[quote]Quote:[hr]KeenRush: (...) part of the problem is that several of these "core" Keeners have became old(er). They have so many different things to worry about.[hr][/quote]

Yeah, that's true. It'd be great to have new, young people here, who would really appreciate the old Keeners' job. For example, I sometimes think while writing my game engine: Who will enjoy this thing? After completeing it, I won't be able to use it. But I'm sure that I'll find someone who'll enjoy a game made with this.

I remember that when I first saw this thread, I felt very sad, because one of the reasons I came here had just left. But life continues, and so does the forum.

The more we are, the better. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Some new members have joined here too, as you probably have just noticed. 3 new active (?) members, to be exact.

And there's a Keen 1 mod in progress, probably it'll be released this March. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dexter.gif[/img]

It's good to see people coming back after some time, heh [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] Hopefully LL will return some day.[hr]SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

title: Re: Goodbye.
content:
May I sue your friend?
[quote]Quote:[hr]Levellord: I have just finnished a wonderfully depressing conversation with KeenRush and am utterly out of it right now. Basically I am leaving the Keen community for I frankly don't know how long.

I shan't be on MSN, though you might contact sarah via it, I don't know what I'm going to be doing the next few days, I really don't. I'm probbably not thinking straight, and I'm sure I'll probbably regret doing all of this stuff if I sat down for half an hour, but frankly I can't be fucked.

I'd just like to say that several of you people are /(null)/.

Thankyou, and goodnight.
[hr][/quote]

It's really stupid to blame the community. What can you expect? Keen has been abandoned for more than a decade, no much we can do these days unless Tom gets the rights.

And I don't think you really need her to return before making levels. We all can make one or two mistakes at the start, but we all humans have the ability to learn from our own mistakes.[hr]SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"
